com.camerontec.catalys.mis.ums

Interface ICustomUserDetailsProvider

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IUserDetailsProvider
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    SampleLDAPUserDetailsProvider

    public interface ICustomUserDetailsProvider
extends IUserDetailsProvider
    This interface must be implemented by custom UMS provider classes. A custom UMS provider is declared in the MIS configuration file as follows: ums/customProviderImplementationClassName=<class name>, where <class name> must be the name of a class implementing this interface and providing an empty constructor.
    The UMS handles the life-cycle of custom providers as follows:
    • If any properties are specified via the MIS configuration file, these properties are injected by method setProperties(Properties). This is done using the following syntax in the MIS configuration file: ums.customProviderProperties[<property name>]=<property value>
    • An ILogger instance is provided via method setLogger(ILogger). This allows the custom UMS provider to issue log messages to the MIS logging system.
    • The custom UMS provider instance is then initialized via method initialize(). Any exception thrown by this method will cause the MIS to fail to start.
    • At the time that the UMS is shutdown, method shutdown() is invoked. Any exception thrown by this method will cause a warning to be reported by the MIS but will not prevent the MIS from shutting down.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void initialize()
      Initializes this custom UMS provider.
